tags: and please for the love of god don’t take this too seriously
summary: Over-analysis #2: “DO PEOPLE IN THE DETECTIVE PIKACHU UNIVERSE EAT POKEMON MEAT???”
title: Over-analysis #2: “DO PEOPLE IN THE DETECTIVE PIKACHU UNIVERSE EAT POKEMON MEAT???”
body:
…you may ask yourself. I don’t think they do, and in fact I think they might have a very reliable alternative:

BERRIES.

Hear me out, berries have always been a staple in the Pokemon game since gen 2 and it makes sense that the production team will include their presence in the movie. But it might be more than that.

In the theatrical poster for Detective Pikachu there’s like three neon advertisement for berries, including “Berry Juice.” Now I know we have places in our world like Jamba Juice and shit like that, but rarely do we see shit like a fucking neon sign advertising just berries or even use the phrase “berry juice.” This must mean that berries in this Pokemon universe have a more significant purpose and contain a higher nutritional value than the lame-o berries that we are used too. (but still eat real berries, kids, it’s good for your health and stuff)

“But how on earth would berries be a substitute to meat, hmmmmm?”

UM, HELLO. Their berries are the super foods that our super foods WISH they were! In addition to curing any status condition (burn, sleep, confusion, etc.), and HEALING WOUNDS, many berries can increase base stats (attack, speed, HP, etc). Now replace “base stats” with “metabolism” and BOOM you effectively have a bunch of berries that’ll pound your immune system, blood, and the rest of your body with nutrients that’ll literally make you faster, stronger, and healthier.

So in conclusion, I expect to see in the movie a society that revolves exclusively around berries and the many ways people consume them. (as well as the cooperation between humans and pokemon, I guess) You can count on them to provide the world with berry-licious delicacies like berry bread, berry noodles, berry gyros, berry salsa, and, most importantly, BERRY BURGERS.

Thank you for your time, please subscribe for more pokemon and berry-related theories.

summary: I want everyone to stop and consider that as of right now, one week after it was released, the Detective Pikachu trailer has...
body:
I want everyone to stop and consider that as of right now, one week after it was released, the Detective Pikachu trailer has amassed over 44 MILLION views on YouTube.

By comparison:

Aquaman’s trailer has just over 41 million views.

Justice League trailer has 35+ million views.

Wonder Woman on the same channel has it’s official trailer at 26.5 million. It’s comic-con trailer 29+ million.

Spider-man Homecoming’s first trailer has 27+ million.

Godzilla King of the Monsters has 21+ Million

Black Panther trailer 1 has 41+ million.

And Detective Pikachu outdid them all IN ONE WEEK!

Heck, Captain Marvel’s trailer has over 45 million, so the film’s quickly catching up to that

Now, it’s views are still significantly lower than the trailers for films like Avengers Infinity War, Star Wars the force awakens and the last jedi, Batman v Superman, Venom, Thor Ragnarok and many other big franchise films of course…

But still think about it. These are all iconic characters with a ton of hype behind their movies, and some of these trailers I mentioned have been out for over a year.

Spider-man has been Marvel’s most iconic character for decades, Wonder Woman is the most iconic superheroine in all of comics and is a character people had been waiting A LONG TIME to see a movie made for her. Black Panther was a breakout character from the Civil War movie and was hyped up as the first black superhero to star in an MCU movie and was hailed as a cultural milestone for that upon release and widely celebrated by Black people, and people of other races around the world, making over 1.3 billion at the box office. Godzilla is a beloved pop cultural icon on par with any of them.

And Detective Pikachu’s trailer got more views and I believe more likes than any of them. In. One. Week.

Like… number of views on YouTube doesn’t completely correlate to success at the box office or anything. Venom and Batman v Superman both have a lot more youtube views on their trailers than Black Panther, which did better business than both of them (Likely due to the terrible critical reception of both films and middling to bad audience reactions in the latter’s case while BP was widely acclaimed).

But still… that’s incredibly impressive, especially considering the trailer dropped the same day as the teaser for Toy Story 4 and news broke out that Stan Lee passed away. Neither of these things overshadowed the reaction and hype for Detective Pikachu (Though I think about as many people were talking about Stan Lee, I just mean it didn’t drown out the discussion or hype at all).

And honestly judging by this reaction, if this movie gets good reviews (Which it might, since early test screenings have proved very positive) and the hype it garnered continues in the lead up to the movie’s release… this film is going to make A LOT of money, possibly more than a number of those films I mentioned. Heck, if all goes well, and it doesn’t get buried too badly by Avengers 4, there’s an actual possibility of it scraping just slightly over a billion

Like… can you imagine, a live action Pokémon movie about Detective Pikachu grossing over $1 billion at the box office. That’s actually a possibility.

I don’t have all the other stats across social media of course, but you’ve got to admit the reaction is still VERY impressive. I underestimate the popularity of the Pokémon franchise sometimes, but this reaction really does hammer home that it’s still a pop cultural juggernaut over 20 years after Red and Blue came out.

summary:
My copy of Let’s Go Pikachu! came in and will start playing this evening, but there is something I need to know.
Is there a...
body:
My copy of Let’s Go Pikachu! came in and will start playing this evening, but there is something I need to know.

Is there a detective hat that Pikachu can wear? Because if there isn’t, damnit Nintendo, what a missed opportunity.

tags: i only knew that the toy story 4 trailer dropped by chance
summary: It is completely hilarious that the trailer for Toy Story 4 came out on the same day as the Detective Pikachu trailer and yet I...
body: It is completely hilarious that the trailer for Toy Story 4 came out on the same day as the Detective Pikachu trailer and yet I haven’t seen a single shred of hype from anyone, whether on my dash or in person. It’s very analogous to how Detective Pikachu is a bold, new move for an IP that has gotten formulaic over the years while Toy Story 4 is beating off a dead horse for blatant cash grabbing purposes. Guess which one gets people talking?
